The key to the CUSTOMER.POSITION file.
Each CUSTOMER.POSITION record is identified by the following components separated by a "*":
1) Liability Number This is a 1-10 numeric CUSTOMER number identifying the Liability group to which the Customer belongs.
2) Customer Number This is a 1-6 numeric Customer number

3) Application system id This is one of the following: - The alpha part of the transaction key E.g FX (FX9512312345) FDOR (FDOR9512312312) - FXBUY for the Buy side of a forex deal - FXSELL for the Sell side of a Forex deal - FXBPL for the profit on the Buy side of a FX deal - FXSPL for the profit on the Sell side of a FX deal - LIAL for the limit amount allocated - LIUT for the limit amount utilised - LCM for the main LETTER.OF.CREDIT record - LCD for the DRAWINGS records - SC for securities portfolio security holdings - CO for non T24 Collateral held
4) Company Mnemonic The 3 character company mnemonic for the company in which the transaction resides.
5) Limit Reference This contains the 7 digit limit reference where the underlying transaction is linked to the limits system.
In the case of transactions which are not linked to the limits system the following values are used:

SCPORT - Securities Portfolio COLL - Non system collateral COMMIT - Commitments CURRACD - Accounts not linked to limits with a Debit balance CURRACC - Accounts not linked to limits with a Credit balance CURRACZ - Accounts not linked to limits with a zero balance
6) Deal / Account number Contains the deal reference / account number / limit / collateral id
Customer Position records are built when CUSTOMER.POSITION enquiries are run.

The transaction is extracted from the underlying deal.
Denotes the level of the Limit record from which the data was extracted.
This field may contain the values:

GLOBAL when extracted from a GLOBAL limit record PRODUCT when extracted from a PRODUCT level limit record, including products under a Global limit. SUB for SUB product limits, including those sub-products under a Global limit.

Transaction data is extracted at both PRODUCT and SUB product level (although not at Global level), so a single transaction may appear twice in the CUSTOMER.POSITION file with 2 different limit references in the key. In enquiries based on transaction information, records with a value of SUB in this field should gemerally be ignored, as all information will be included in the PRODUCT level record.
GLOBAL records will only contain a value for LIMIT records defined at that level.
